intro: Klasea pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved klasea, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or white. Native to certain regions of southern Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Klasea pinnatifida is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
